examples: Her brother is the bane of her life.
It's the bane of my life!
I swear, this project is the bane of my existence.
Can you guys do Bane?
My main nemesis is Bane.
words.defineEn: something causing misery or death
words.defineVi: một cái gì đó gây ra đau khổ hoặc cái chết

examples: Even the banter and the slang in the background I tried to make specific to Oakland.
Honestly as much fun as the questions are, it's at the banter afterwards.
But the trips that Heidi enjoyed most were the ones where she could relax and enjoy the banter with those around her.
words.defineEn: light teasing repartee
words.defineVi: đối đáp trêu chọc nhẹ

examples: By the 4th century BCE, Greek engineers began making actual automatons including robotic servants and flying models of birds.
Such inventions led scientists and philosophers to speculate that the human brain itself was just an elaborate automaton.
His zombies have, from the beginning, represented so much more than just mindless flesh-eating automatons.
Illustrating the demise of Talos on a vase of the fifth century BCE, one painter captured the dying automaton’s despair with a tear rolling down his bronze cheek.
If the work is created by an entity other than a human, like say a monkey or a mindless automaton or an employee, that creator is not an author.
words.defineEn: a mechanism that can move automatically
words.defineVi: một cơ chế có thể di chuyển tự động

examples: Autobiographies should be taken with a grain of salt.
Her shocking autobiography is about to hit the streets.
The Arabic-language autobiography spent decades in private collections, before the library acquired it in 2017.
It's titled Autobiography: Water/Ancestors/Middle Passage/Family Ghosts.
McCain wrote about it in his autobiography, "Faith of My Fathers."
words.defineEn: the story of the life of a person, written by the same person
words.defineVi: câu chuyện về cuộc đời của một người, được viết bởi cùng một người

examples: We can do autopsies.

Their autopsy revealed the characteristic signs of strangulation: the quiescent galaxies had much higher levels of heavy metals than the living, star-forming galaxies.

This is a six-foot autopsy of a man.
words.defineEn: an examination and dissection of a dead body to determine cause of death or the changes produced by disease

words.defineEn: live in or as if in a tent
words.defineVi: sống trong hoặc như thể trong một cái lều

examples: This news conference, Bill, encapsulated the president's thinking, his reasoning and frankly his frustration over the events that took place over the weekend in Charlottesville.
But once it leaves the body, a layer of water encapsulates it as well.
It's not just totally encapsulated in the specific case at hand.
So some interval around the mean that encapsulates 95% of the area.
This is very similar to what we’ve done all series long: hide complexity by encapsulating low-level details in higher-order components.
words.defineEn: enclose in a capsule or other small container
words.defineVi: đặt trong một viên nang hoặc hộp đựng nhỏ khác

examples: It's a Spanish enclave at the northern tip of the country.

In late September, war again broke out between Armenia and Azerbaijan over the coveted enclave of Nagorno-Karabakh.
The former Soviet republic of Armenia and Azerbaijan went to war again over the enclave of Nagorno-Karabakh, drawing in regional powers.
The former Soviet republic of Armenia and Azerbaijan went to war again over the enclave of Nagorno-Karabakh, drawing in regional powers.
words.defineEn: an enclosed territory that is culturally distinct from the foreign territory that surrounds it
words.defineVi: một lãnh thổ khép kín khác biệt về mặt văn hóa với lãnh thổ nước ngoài bao quanh nó

examples: It encompasses so many ingredients, so much soul, so much history so much culture.
The old-school definition can encompass any wonky collection of cells in your body.
So the eating disorder kind of encompasses a feeling and symptoms like BDD.
It can also encompass related concepts, like physical safety.
The new reliability standard also encompasses disruptions or attempts to disrupt the operation of a bulk electric system or cyber system.
words.defineEn: to include a wide range of different things; to completely cover something
words.defineVi: để bao gồm một loạt các thứ khác nhau; để hoàn toàn bao gồm một cái gì đó

examples: Indiscriminate and reckless bombing like this may be a war crime.

And of course, these indiscriminate rocket attacks on israeli civilians, which have elicited the RESPONSE that they did, because ISRAEL has a right to Defend Itself.

We are seeing lots and lots of cameras out, lots and lots of video footage being caught of a kind of indiscriminate and excessive use of these weapons, often against unarmed and nonviolent protesters.
words.defineEn: failing to make or recognize distinctions
words.defineVi: không thực hiện hoặc nhận ra sự khác biệt

examples: Lamborghinis futuristic designs, bold colors, massive engines, and trademark scissor doors have been indispensable in establishing this reputation.

I believe we're at the very beginning of the indispensable role of health tech.

Numerous consulting houses, such as the Swiss firm AntOptima, have embraced them as an indispensable tool.
words.defineEn: absolutely necessary, essential, vital, or crucial, to the point that being replaced or substituted is not possible
words.defineVi: hoàn toàn cần thiết, thiết yếu, quan trọng, hoặc quan trọng, đến mức không thể thay thế hoặc thay thế được

examples: Outside these ranges the notes become indistinct.

(indistinct) - All right, Stop the pump.

words.defineEn: not clearly defined or easy to perceive or understand
words.defineVi: không được xác định rõ ràng hoặc dễ nhận thức hoặc hiểu

words.defineEn: impossible to avoid or evade
words.defineVi: không thể tránh hoặc trốn tránh

examples: Yeah, I feel totally inept.

examples: The scientist faced numerous challenges and obstacles in his research, but remembered that a handful of patience is worth more than a bushel of brains, and persisted with determination and hard work until he finally made groundbreaking discoveries.

examples: You're just a persnickety little Simon, I know you are.

words.defineVi: đặc trưng bởi độ chính xác quá mức và chú ý đến các chi tiết nhỏ

examples: He didn’t provide a mechanism for how this devolution worked, and he later recanted his controversial views.

examples: The last row doesn't even recline.

examples: The employee who made a mistake at work quickly admitted his fault, knowing that a fault confessed is half redressed, and worked hard to make amends for the error.

The matter of reparations is one of making amends and direct redress, but it also a question of citizenship.

The first amendment, for example, says that "congress shall make no law respecting the establishment of religion, or abridging the free exercise thereof, or abridging the freedom of speech or of the press to assemble or to infringe the right to petition the government for redress of grievances."
words.defineEn: make reparations or amends for
words.defineVi: thực hiện bồi thường hoặc sửa đổi cho
